info.title: Weni by VTEX API
info.description:
Weni Flows lets you visually build interactive SMS applications and launch them anywhere in the world. We provide a RESTful JSON API for you to interact with your data from outside applications.

## API Overview

All endpoints follow standard REST conventions. You can list a set of resources by making a `GET` request to the endpoint, create or update resources by making a `POST` or `PUT` request, or delete a resource with a `DELETE` request.

To use the endpoint simply append `.json` to the URL. For example `/api/v2/flows` will return the documentation for that endpoint but a request to `/api/v2/flows.json` will return a JSON list of flows.

## Authentication

All API requests require authentication using an API Token. Include the token in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Token {your-token}
```

You can obtain your API token by logging into your Weni Fluxos account.

## Rate Limiting

- **429**: You have exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint.

## Common Response Codes

- **200**: Success
- **400**: Bad Request - The request was invalid
- **401**: Unauthorized - Authentication credentials were not provided or are invalid
- **404**: The resource was not found (returned by `POST` and `DELETE` methods)
- **429**: You have exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint

get.description: List the data archives of messages and runs associated with your account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: API Token for authentication. Format: `Token {your-token}`

parameters.name: archive_type
parameters.description:
Type of the archive. The following values are accepted:
- `message`
- `run`

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
Period of the archive. The following values are accepted:
- `daily`
- `monthly`

results.description: List of archives of messages and runs.

start_date.description: Start date of the archive. Follows the UTC time format: `YYYY-MM-DDT`.

period.description:
Period of the archive. The following values are accepted:
- `daily`
- `monthly`

record_count.description: Number of records in the archive.

size.description: Size of the gzipped archive in bytes.

hash.description: MD5 hash of the gzipped archive.

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication credentials were not provided or are invalid

404.description: Not Found - The resource was not found

429.description: Rate limit exceeded - You have exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint

get.description: List the administrative boundaries for your organization.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: API Token for authentication. Format: `Token {your-token}`

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description:
Geometry of the boundaries, in the GeoJSON MultiPolygon format. To include the geometry in the response, set this parameter to `true`. 
 > ⚠️ Including the geometry in the response may produce a very large result. We recommend caching the results on the client's side.

results.description: List with the results of administrative boundaries.

osm_id.description: OSM ID for this boundary prefixed with the element type.

parent.description: The ID of the containing parent of this boundary,

osm_id.description: OSM ID for the parent boundary prefixed with the element type.

level.description: Refers to the level of the administrative boundary. The value `0` indicates that the boundary is a country, the value `1` indicates that the boundary is a state, and the value `2` indicates that the boundary is a city, and the value `4` indicates that the boundary is a district.

aliases.description: List of aliases for the administrative boundary.

geometry.description: Geometry of the boundary, in the GeoJSON MultiPolygon format.

coordinates.description: List of coordinates that make part of the geometry.

items.description: Coordinates that make part of the geometry.

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication credentials were not provided or are invalid

404.description: Not Found - The resource was not found

429.description: Rate limit exceeded - You have exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint

get.description: Send new message broadcasts and list existing broadcasts in your account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: API Token for authentication. Format: Token {your-token}

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the broadcast.

urns.description: List of URNs that receive the broadcast.

contacts.description: List of contacts that received the broadcast.

items.description: Information of the contact that received the broadcast.

groups.description: List of groups that received the broadcast.

items.description: Information about the groups that received the broadcast.

created_on.description: The date when the broadcast was created in the UTC time format: `YYYY-MM-DDT`.

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication credentials were not provided or are invalid

404.description: Not Found - The resource was not found

429.description: Rate limit exceeded - You have exceeded the rate limit for this endpoint

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: API Token for authentication. Format: Token {your-token}

text.description: The text of the broadcast. You can send a text of up to 640 characters per request.

urns.description: List of URNs that will receive the broadcast. You can send up to 100 URNs per request.

Before.name: before
Before.description: Start date of the archive. Follows the UTC time format: `YYYY-MM-DDT`.

After.name: after
After.description: End date of the archive. Follows the UTC time format: `YYYY-MM-DDT`.

NextPage.description: URL of the next page. You can use this URL to make a new request and see the results of the following page.

PreviousPage.description: URL of the previous page. You can use this URL to make a new request and see the results of the previous page.

Count.description: Total number of results in the current page.
